introduction: This video discusses the reasons behind the slow performance of the 'SELECT \*' statement in a relational database. The author explains how full table scans, deserialization costs, and network latency contribute to the slow performance and provides examples to illustrate the impact of each factor.

sections.title: Section 1: Understanding Full Table Scans
content: Explanation of how full table scans work in relational databases.
Discussion of the impact of full table scans on query performance.
Comparison of full table scans with index-based scans.
Examples of when full table scans are necessary or beneficial.

sections.title: Section 2: Deserialization Costs
content: Explanation of deserialization costs in relational databases.
Discussion of how deserialization costs affect query performance.
Comparison of deserialization costs with other query optimization techniques.
Examples of when deserialization costs are high or problematic.

sections.title: Section 3: Network Latency
content: Explanation of network latency in relational databases.
Discussion of how network latency affects query performance.
Comparison of network latency with other query optimization techniques.
Examples of when network latency is high or problematic.

sections.title: Section 4: Optimizing Query Performance
content: Discussion of best practices for optimizing query performance in relational databases.
Explanation of how to use indexes and other query optimization techniques effectively.
Comparison of different query optimization techniques and their trade-offs.
Examples of how to apply these techniques in practice.

sections.title: Section 5: Conclusion
content: Summary of the key points discussed in the video.
Discussion of the importance of understanding query performance in relational databases.
Suggestions for further learning and resources on query optimization.
Final thoughts and closing remarks.
